page.title: 07Farming in North Hastings.
page.content: Above Hastings the high ridge looks north across the Rother valley and the Weald.It is still heavily wooded largely with deciduous trees.Over wide areas of this patch are small farms consisting largely of{permanent {pasture and some grassland for hay. {Stock includes dairy and beef cattle {and sheep.Milk is supplied to the {local dairying industry}for consumpti- on in Hastings and St.Leonards.The ne- arest market is at Rye.The area also includes a{market gardening industry {for fruit}where southern slopes make this a profitable economy.Adams fruit farm employs casual labour intensively once crops ripen.Many customers pick and pay for their own needs.Straw- berries predominate but raspberries and blackberries are sent in bulk for freezing and export to Germany and Sweden.
